en: The king’s heart is in the hand of Jehovah as the watercourses: He turneth it whithersoever he will.
hmr: Lal lungril chu tui luong ruomhai angin LALPA kuta chun a um a, Ama nuomna tieng tieng a hêm hlak.

en: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes; But Jehovah weigheth the hearts.
hmr: Mihriem lampui tin el chu ama mithmua chun ân dik a, Amiruokchu, LALPA chun lungril chu ân khi hlak a nih.

en: To do righteousness and justice Is more acceptable to Jehovah than sacrifice.
hmr: Rorêlna le thil fel thaw hi, Inthâwina nêkin LALPA ta dingin pawmtlâk a ni lem dai.

en: A high look, and a proud heart, Even the lamp of the wicked, is sin.
hmr: Meng insâng le lungril chapo, Mi khawhlo khâwnvar ngei khawm chu suol a nih.

en: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; But every one that is hasty hasteth only to want.
hmr: Mi taima ngaituonahai chun hau hnawkna a âwn a, Amiruokchu, mi tin inhmaw ta hrim hrim chu tlasam ding chaua inhmaw a nih.

en: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue Is a vapor driven to and fro by them that seek death.
hmr: Lei khêlinhlip leia hausakna hmu chu, Hmatieng hnungtienga tuihu lên hmanga um ang chu a na, a zawngtuhai chun thina an zawng a nih.

en: The violence of the wicked shall sweep them away, Because they refuse to do justice.
hmr: Mi khawhlo hrângsietna chun anni chu hrût hmang a tih, Rorêlna indik thaw an nuom naw leiin.

en: The way of him that is laden with guilt is exceeding crooked; But as for the pure, his work is right.
hmr: Mi khawhlo lampui chu a kâwi hle a, Mi inthieng sinthaw ruok chu a tluong a nih.

en: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, Than with a contentious woman in a wide house.
hmr: Nuhmei hrângsie le in liena um nêk chun, Inchung sîp kilkhâwra chêng chu a ṭha lem.

en: The soul of the wicked desireth evil: His neighbor findeth no favor in his eyes.
hmr: Mi khawhlo lungril chun thil suol a châk a, A mithmua chun a tuolbâwm chun ditsakna hrim a hmu nawh.

en: When the scoffer is punished, the simple is made wise; And when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
hmr: Hmusittu chu hrem a ni pha chun, mi mâwl chu sukvar a na, Mi var chu inchûktir a ni pha chun, hrietna a hmu hlak.

en: The righteous man considereth the house of the wicked, How the wicked are overthrown to their ruin.
hmr: Mi fel chun mi khawhlo sûng- kuo chu a ngaituo hlak a; Iengtizieha mi khawhlohai chu an sietnaa pei thlâk am an niha ti hi.

en: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, He also shall cry, but shall not be heard.
hmr: Tukhawm mi pasie khêk ria a nahai suksêt chu, Ama khawm khêk ngei a ta, amiruokchu, ngai ni naw nih.

en: A gift in secret pacifieth anger; And a present in the bosom, strong wrath.
hmr: A rûka thilthlâwnpêk hin lunginsenna a sukre a, Ângsûnga thilpêk hin lungin- senna nasatak a sukre.

en: It is joy to the righteous to do justice; But it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.
hmr: Rorêlna indik hi mi fel ta ding chun hlimum a na, Thil suol thawtuhai ta ding ruok chun sietna a nih.

en: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding Shall rest in the assembly of the dead.
hmr: Mi hrietthiemna lampuia inthawka invâkhmang chu Mithihai inkhâwmnaa chun châwl a tih.

en: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: He that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
hmr: Nuomsipna ngaina mi chu mi pasie nîng a ta, Uoin le hriek ngaina mi chu hausa ngai naw nih.

en: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; And the treacherous cometh in the stead of the upright.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chu mi fel ta dinga intlanna a na, Bawsetu chu mi tluong aiawin a hung bawk.

en: It is better to dwell in a desert land, Than with a contentious and fretful woman.
hmr: Nuhmei awnazawng le hrângsie le um nêkin, Thlalêr rama um a ṭha lem.

en: There is precious treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; But a foolish man swalloweth it up.
hmr: Mi var chêngnaa chun hriek le hausakna hlutak chu a um a, Mi invêt ruok chun a lem zo hlak.

en: He that followeth after righteousness and kindness Findeth life, righteousness, and honor.
hmr: Zângaina le felna hnawttu chun, Hringna, felna le inzâkaina a hmu hlak.

en: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, And bringeth down the strength of the confidence thereof.
hmr: Mi var chun mi hrât khawpui chu ân khih a, Chutaka inringzona hrâtna chu a sukhnuoi hlak.

en: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue Keepeth his soul from troubles.
hmr: Tukhawm a lei le a bau vêng ṭha chun, Buoinahaia inthawkin a lungril chu a vêng ṭha a nih.

en: The proud and haughty man, scoffer is his name; He worketh in the arrogance of pride.
hmr: Mi chapo le mi uong chu a hming chu Hmusittu a na, Inphûloin chaponaah sin a thawh a.

en: The desire of the sluggard killeth him; For his hands refuse to labor.
hmr: Mi thabo nuom zâwng chun ama a that a, A kuthai chun sinthaw inrim a nuom nawh a.

en: There is that coveteth greedily all the day long; But the righteous giveth and withholdeth not.
hmr: Sûnnithlâk thlâk ela duâmtak- a inhnar hlak chu a um a, Mi fel ruok chun a pêk a, ân ro ngai nawh.

en: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; How much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind!
hmr: Mi khawlo inthawina chu tirdakum a na, Lungril suola a hung lâk pha lem chun a va ni nasa âwm de!

en: A false witness shall perish; But the man that heareth shall speak so as to endure.
hmr: Thuhretu indik naw chu bohmang a ta, Thuhretu indik thu ruok chu sêldawng ni naw nih.

en: A wicked man hardeneth his face; But as for the upright, he establisheth his ways.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chun a hmai a sukngar a, Mi tluong ruok chun a lampuihai a rêl fel.

en: There is no wisdom nor understanding Nor counsel against Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA kal zâwnga thurâwn amanih, Hrietthiemna amanih, varna amani khawm a um nawh.

en: The horse is prepared against the day of battle; But victory is of Jehovah.
hmr: Sakawr chu indo nia ding chun buotsai a ni hlak a, Hnêna ruok chu LALPA ta a nih.
